org.smtlib

Class SolverProcess

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smtlib.SolverProcess

  • public class SolverProcess
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements launching, writing to, and reading responses from a launched process (in particular, solver processes).
    Author:
    David Cok

    • Nested Class Summary

      Modifier and Type Class and Description

      Wraps an exception thrown because of a failure in the prover

      • bufferCollection

        private static java.util.List<char[]> bufferCollection
        A pool of buffers used by listenThru. The listenThru method needs a buffer, which may need to be big. However, the method is called often and we do not want to be continually allocating big buffers that have to wait around to be garbage collected. Especially since, unless there are multiple SMT processes working simultaneously, we will never need more than one of these. But in order to be thread-safe we cannot simply declare a static buffer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SolverProcess

        public SolverProcess(java.lang.String[] cmd,
             java.lang.String endMarker,
             java.lang.String logfile)
        Constructs a SolverProcess object, without actually starting the process as yet.
        Parameters:
        args - the command-line that will launch the desired process
        endMarker - text that marks the end of text returned from the process, e.g. the end of the prompt for new input
        log - if not null, the name of a file to log communications to, for diagnostic purposes

    • Method Detail

      • setCmd

        public void setCmd(java.lang.String[] cmd)
        Enables changing the command-line; must be called prior to start()

      • start

        public void start(boolean listen)
           throws SolverProcess.ProverException
        Starts the process; if the argument is true, then also listens to its output until a prompt is read.
        Throws:
        SolverProcess.ProverException

      • listen

        public java.lang.String listen()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Listens to the process's standard output until the designated endMarker is read and to the error output. If there is error output, it is returned; otherwise the standard output is returned.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • exit

        public void exit()
        Aborts the process

      • listenThru

        public static java.lang.String listenThru(java.io.Reader r,
                          java.lang.String end)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the given Reader until the given String is read (or end of input is reached); may block until input is available; the stopping string must occur at the end of the input. This is typically used to read through a prompt on standard output; when the stopping string (the prompt) is read, one knows that the output from the program is complete and not to wait for any more.
        Parameters:
        r - the Reader to read characters from
        end - a stopping String
        Returns:
        the String read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO failure occurs
